meanings.definition: A type of music and dance originating in Colombia.
meanings.sent1: The lively cumbia music filled the air at the festival.
meanings.sent2: People danced joyfully to the rhythmic cumbia beats.
meanings.sent3: The cumbia music was so catchy that even the birds started dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like a cumbia rhythm through the room.
meanings.sent5: The cumbia melodies painted a colorful picture in my mind.

meanings.definition: A style of music characterized by a rhythmic beat and folk influences.
meanings.sent1: The band played a lively cumbia tune at the party.
meanings.sent2: The cumbia rhythm got everyone on their feet.
meanings.sent3: The cumbia beat was so infectious that even the shyest person couldn't resist dancing.
meanings.sent4: His heart beat to the cumbia of the drums.
meanings.sent5: The cumbia music flowed through the room like a gentle river.

meanings.definition: A genre of Latin American music incorporating elements of African and indigenous cultures.
meanings.sent1: The fusion of cultures was evident in the vibrant cumbia melodies.
meanings.sent2: The cumbia songs told stories of tradition and heritage.
meanings.sent3: The cumbia music brought together people from different backgrounds in harmony.
meanings.sent4: Heritage and rhythm intertwined in the beautiful cumbia tunes.
meanings.sent5: The cumbia beats carried the soul of generations past.
